intro: Oxydectes payeriana, commonly known as the Payer's oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and clustered umbels of small white or greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its foliage consists of finely divided, aromatic leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Oxydectes payeriana is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
